newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia bank sells 70.6 mln kuna bills, rates rise.
newsitem.headline: Croatia bank sells 70.6 mln kuna bills, rates rise.

text.p: The National Bank of Croatia sold 70.6 million kuna in five- and 13-week liquidity bills at higher rates at a weekly auction.
Although slight, it was the first rate increase in almost three months, following a steady decline from interest well above 20 percent.
A total of 67.6 million kuna worth of five-week bills were sold at 8.00 percent, up from 7.98 percent at the last regular tender.
The 13-week rate rose to 10.00 from 9.25 percent as the central bank accepted a bid for three million kuna.
It received no bids for 26-week paper, last issued at 17.50 percent late in July.
